summary: This is an email exchange between law enforcement officials regarding investigative steps in the Epstein case. It discusses a WhatsApp search for a phone number and a DAS database search for 301 E 66th Street, a property linked to Epstein and his modeling agency MC2.

persons.name: Detective
persons.role: NYPD Detective assigned to FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: The detective sends search results for a WhatsApp phone number query and a DAS search for 301 E 66th Street, noting the building has many records.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.role: Federal prosecutor in the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Requests investigative steps including obtaining provider information for a phone number from a SORNA registration, a WhatsApp search, and database searches on 301 E 66th Street, a property linked to Epstein and MC2 models.

persons.name: N. (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: Primary recipient of the email from the AUSA and the detective; part of the investigative team.

persons.name: (USANYS)
persons.role: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York staff
persons.context: Copied on the email from the AUSA regarding investigative next steps.

connections.description: The detective sends investigative search results directly to the FBI agent, indicating they are working together on the task force.
The AUSA emails the FBI agent with requests for specific investigative steps, showing a prosecutorial-investigative working relationship.
The AUSA copies the USANYS office on the email, indicating internal coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Investigation coordination email
events.description: Law enforcement officials coordinate next investigative steps, including searches related to a phone number and Epstein-linked property.

locations.context: A 13-story apartment building searched in a DAS database; property appears to be owned at least in part by Jeffrey Epstein and used to house models for his agency MC2.
Address of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, from which the AUSA email originates.

keyFacts: Investigators were searching a phone number associated with a SORNA (Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act) registration, indicating a focus on a registered sex offender.
301 E 66th Street is identified as a property owned at least in part by Jeffrey Epstein and used to house models for his modeling agency MC2.
A DAS (possibly Digital Analysis System or similar database) search for 301 E 66th Street returned over 2000 records, highlighting the scale of data associated with the address.
The communication shows active coordination between the NYPD, FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force, and the U.S. Attorney's Office in December 2018 regarding the Epstein investigation.
